section.title: Glossary of Terms for SystemBuilder
section.para: These terms are specific to the SystemBuilder environment, not to Linux or applications that run on Linux. The content arrangement is alphabetical.

listitem.para: "System Definition File Reference," the rules of syntax for the system definition file.
The information SystemBuilder uses to build, configure and store your distribution. By convention the text file uses the .xml extension. The file uses XML tagging as defined in the SDFR.
The id for an distribution. The default value consists of the /name, /version and /arch child elements of the main TLE in the definition file, e.g. $NAME-$VERSION-$ARCH.
The server on which SystemBuilder is installed.
The target system on which distribution contents are installed.
The machine from which client systems download distribution contents. It may be the build system.
A software function within SystemBuilder that executes.
Within a SystemBuilder development - staging - production environment, it serves as the download server from which clients retrieve the distribution contents to install.
The development portion of a development - staging - production environment for a SystemBuilder distribution build management system.
The server within a development - staging - production environment that uses SystemBuilder to build production-ready system distributions for migration to the production, or download, server.
An element in the definition file XML syntax that corresponds to a SystemBuilder module. See Also .
